meanings.definition: A pointed wooden or metal stake driven into the ground, typically to form a fence or support a plant.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used pickets to mark the boundary of his garden.
meanings.sent2: The pickets around the flower bed kept the rabbits away.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the pickets but fell off comically.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the pickets holding up the fence.
meanings.sent5: The pickets stood tall, casting long shadows in the evening sun.

meanings.definition: A person or group of people stationed outside a workplace or other location as part of a strike or protest.
meanings.sent1: The pickets chanted slogans outside the factory gates.
meanings.sent2: The pickets peacefully protested for fair wages.
meanings.sent3: The pickets shared jokes to keep their spirits high during the strike.
meanings.sent4: Their unity was a wall that no management could break through, like pickets standing strong.
meanings.sent5: The pickets' determination was unwavering, like a lighthouse guiding ships in a storm.

meanings.definition: A pointed or sharpened end of a tool or weapon.
meanings.sent1: The pickets of the spear gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The sword's pickets were sharp and deadly.
meanings.sent3: The chef carefully sharpened the pickets of the knife before slicing the vegetables.
meanings.sent4: His words were like pickets, piercing through her defenses.
meanings.sent5: The pickets of the arrow found their mark with precision.
